intro: Microdactylon cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The leaves are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance and aiding in water conservation.
